rsbNotes.title: Pr 3:27–35
rsbNotes.text: 3:27–35 The section begins with a series of commandments about certain abuses in human relationships (vv. 27–31). These are followed by clauses explaining the Lord’s direct interest in the morality of these precepts (vv. 32–35).

rsbNotes.title: Pr 3:33
rsbNotes.text: 3:33 Here the typical proverbial contrast between the righteous and the wicked (cf. 10:2, 3, 6, 7, 11, 16) is related to God’s blessings and curses. This parallels the covenant theology of Deuteronomy, in which faithfulness is rewarded by the blessings of God (Deut. 11:26–29; 28:1–19).
